title: The Year In Tech: Net Neutrality, Hollywood Hacks, Wearables
teaser: A look back at 2014 reveals a year of diverse ups and downs for an industry that has quickly become the wunderkind of the world.
contentencoded:
As we head into 2015, it seems all eyes in the tech world are on North Korea and the hack on Sony Pictures Entertainment.

But a look back reveals a year of diverse ups and downs for an industry that has quickly become the wunderkind of the world.

Here & Now’s Lisa Mullins spoke with Kara Swisher of Re/code for a look into the year’s greatest tech moments.

The Highlights

  • The iCloud hackers with stolen celebrity nudes
  • Heartbleed, an epic web vulnerability
  • Uber went from scrappy startup to global Goliath.
  • The FCC got unusual time in the spotlight as the nation debated net neutrality.
  • Wearables became the norm.
  • Alibaba came to the U.S.
  • #Gamergate came to every Twitter feed ever, whether you liked it or not.

Guest

  • Kara Swisher, managing editor for the tech news site Re/Code. She tweets @karaswisher.
